channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Firm that called 2025 nearly perfectly — until a moment of doubt — now has highest S&P 500 target on Wall Street
item.description: Oppenheimer says the S&P 500 will push ahead in 2026, boosted by the economy and corporate profits that are likely to keep holding up.

item.title: Goldman Sachs is pinning hopes on these consumers in 2026. Here are the stock picks.
item.description: Rising revenues in 2026 should help out the middle consumer and boost stocks catering to them, says Goldman Sachs.

item.title: ‘It’s a perilous choice’: I’ve been offered a part-time job. Do I file for Social Security at 67 or 70?
item.description: “My income will be reduced to less than one-fifth of my current annual salary.”

item.title: My mother is selling my late father’s multimillion-dollar California real-estate portfolio — must I stand idly by?
My mother-in-law, 81, is guilting us to pay for her ‘bucket list’ trip to Italy. Do we say no?
item.description: “I have my own trip to Europe planned for next year and I can’t afford both trips.”

item.title: Netflix gets a downgrade after announcing Warner Bros. film and streaming acquisition
item.description: Analyst Jeffrey Wlodarczak downgraded the streaming stock to a hold rating from buy.

item.title: Bank of America hikes Carvana price target following S&P 500 inclusion announcement
item.description: Bank of America sees shares of Carvana adding 14% from here.

item.title: Huge Wall Street call: Morgan Stanley's new Tesla analyst downgrades stock over valuation concerns
item.description: The analyst downgraded Tesla's stock to equal weight from overweight.

item.title: Chinese internet companies are ramping AI spending. These local players may benefit
item.description: Chinese internet companies increasingly say they don't have enough compute to power their artificial intelligence ambitions.

item.title: Top Wall Street analysts favor these 3 stocks for their growth potential
item.description: TipRanks' ranking service highlights three stocks, including Credo Technology and Walmart.
